content: Investments ETF PFF Panel 2 Seedly PFF 2019 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Mar 201920 year time horizon Insurance company endowment plan VS 20 year time horizon RSS DCA ETF, which is better? Which one has higher returns in the long run? 2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 06 Aug 2019Etf for sure. The endowment gives a return of about 3% - 5% at most, whereas an Etf like the STI returns about 7-8%. Plus you don't need to pay high commission for the Etf2 comments0

Question Poster06 Aug 2019Hi STI ETF gives a return of 7-8%? Are you certain that itâ€™s that high? This is for ES3, one of the 2 STI etfs available https://sg.finance.yahoo.com/quote/ES3.SI/performance/
Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Mar 2019Definitely the ETF is better just that it will be more volatile in the short run.0 comments0
